case_vignette: A 27-year-old woman visits a psychiatrist expressing her feelings of sadness which are present on most days of the week. She says that she has been feeling this way for about 2 to 3 years. During her first pregnancy 3 years ago, the fetus died in utero, and the pregnancy was terminated at 21 weeks. Ever since then, she hasn’t been able to sleep well at night and has difficulty concentrating on her tasks most of the time. However, for the past month, she has found it more difficult to cope. She says she has no will to have another child as she still feels guilty and responsible for the previous pregnancy. Over the past few days, she has completely lost her appetite and only eats once or twice a day. She doesn’t recall a single day in the last 3 years where she has not felt this way. The patient denies any past or current smoking, alcohol, or recreational drug use.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling sad most days of the week and I've completely lost my appetite, only eating once or twice a day recently.
How long have you been feeling this way?
I have been feeling this way for about 2 to 3 years.
Have you noticed any changes in your sleep patterns, like sleeping too much or too little?
Yes, ever since my pregnancy ended 3 years ago, I haven't been able to sleep well at night.
Have you experienced any significant weight change since these symptoms started?
I didn't mention any weight changes specifically.
I apologize for the oversight. Are you currently taking any medications?
No, I didn't mention taking any medications.
Do you have a family history of depression or any other mental health conditions?
I didn't mention anything about my family history.
Do you have any difficulty concentrating or making decisions on a daily basis?
Yes, I have difficulty concentrating on my tasks most of the time.
Have you experienced any thoughts of death or suicide?
I didn't mention having thoughts of death or suicide.
Final Diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder
